channel.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
channel.description:
Well, my laptop's so fucked up that even the professionals didn't know what the problem was, they said even if I do get a whole new screen, that may not even be the problem, could be in the motherboard. So, mum says, I can get a new laptop, providing I pay for it.
I want a laptop that'll play Call of Duty games preferably, thus capable of rendering high quality model scenes in minimal time, unlike my budget >£400 laptop which could take up to 2 hours for a single 800x600 image. I'm prepared to spend up to £800.
Currently looking at these two, [url=http://www.laptopsdirect.co.uk/Samsung_R720-JA02UK_Laptop_NP-R720-JS02UK/version.asp#top]Samsung R720[/url] and the [url=http://www1.euro.dell.com/uk/en/home/Laptops/studio-1747/pd.aspx?refid=studio-1747&s=dhs&cs=ukdhs1&ref=lthp]Dell Studio 17 (top range £699 or the £649)[/url].
Both pretty awesome, what do you think?
P.s, forgot to mention, typing this on my good old desktop which I managed to get back up and running with a little modification today.

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:17, topic:329908”]Ok, decided to go for the Dell.

Will be arriving on 12th March, even got the home insurance company to pay £500 towards it, good deal 'ey? ;D[/quote]Very good ;D
my friend is getting a new comp soon too. Arriving march 3rd I think.

Read full topic

item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Personally, i would say the dell laptop is better, however the samsung is cheaper and as bad… so it depends wether you want to save yourself some cash and have one that isn’t quite as good or go all out and get the dell

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800

item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:1, topic:329908”]Well, my laptop’s so fucked up that even the professionals didn’t know what the problem was, they said even if I do get a whole new screen, that may not even be the problem, could be in the motherboard.
So, mum says, I can get a new laptop, providing I pay for it.

I want a laptop that’ll play Call of Duty games preferably, thus capable of rendering high quality model scenes in minimal time, unlike my budget >£400 laptop which could take up to 2 hours for a single 800x600 image.
I’m prepared to spend up to £800.

Currently looking at these two, Samsung R720 and the Dell Studio 17 (top range £699 or the £649).

Both pretty awesome, what do you think?

P.s, forgot to mention, typing this on my good old desktop which I managed to get back up and running with a little modification today.[/quote]
I have a 15in. Dell Studio. It’s not bad, but I’d rather have a Macbook Air, running some version of Windows xp or >.

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:9, topic:329908”]http://www.laptopsdirect.co.uk/HP_Pavilion_dv6-2106ea_Windows_7_Laptop_WA052EA/version.asp

Little expensive but look at the benchmarks on the NVIDIA GeForce GT 230M.[/quote]

That’s pretty nice, that would be my second choice, I think I’m stuck on the Dell though, after looking at the graphics card capabilities I think it’s more than enough for my needs.

[quote=“shrogg, post:10, topic:329908”]well knowing how much power you need to render a good pic in 3ds (now i have made a few vids and models usin it)
i wouldent have a clue, get the one with the best prosessor (the dell 1 i think)
but yeah, for rendering a pic with all the enhanced lighting and effects it takes a while on my gaming pc…[/quote]

Oh, what’s the specs for yours?
I’m sure it can’t be as bad as my old one.

This image here, took me 1 hour and 40 minutes to render:

Just a simple door, lolol.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Lin:

I don’t see why people post topics asking if a product is good, or want suggestions… Obviously, just look at the game requirements and compare with the PC specs. Then look for the price and THERE YA GO WOOT!

I know, I normally dislike them topics too, but I’ve been searching for like 5 hours and finally came to these 2 and cannot decide.
And it’s not just about whether it’ll play the games.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

But is it really worth the extra £100 more than the Samsung?

And the Samsung is said to run Call of Duty 4 at over 25fps, on the lowest detail settings, which is fairly good, so, either would be decent.

Although, I really wanna be able to play CoD: WaW, because of custom zombie maps.

Read full topic

item.title: New laptop, £500 - £800
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Hmm.
Choosing between the laptops given, I would choose for the Dell Studio 17, the £699 one.
You’re saying you want a laptop that would be able to play CoD games, so it is best to pick the laptop with the best performance. In this case that would be the higher priced Dell Studio 17.
It has best processor, most RAM, and best videocard out of the 3 laptops.

Read full topic
